headline: Coca-Cola names a company veteran as its new CEO
summary: Coca-Cola said Wednesday that its chief operating officer will become its next CEO in the first quarter of 2026.  The Atlanta beverage giant said its board elected Henrique Braun as CEO effective March 31.  Braun, 57, has worked at Coca-Cola for three decades.

content.title: Coca-Cola names a company veteran as its new CEO
content.summary: Coca-Cola said Wednesday that its chief operating officer will become its next CEO in the first quarter of 2026.  The Atlanta beverage giant said its board elected Henrique Braun as CEO effective March 31.  Braun, 57, has worked at Coca-Cola for three decades.

headline: Coca-Cola announces major leadership change as Henrique Braun is named next CEO
summary: Coca-Cola named Henrique Braun as its new CEO, effective March 2026, replacing James Quincey, who will transition to executive chairman after nine years.

headline: What leadership changes mean for consumer brands like Coca-Cola
summary: Coca-Cola (KO) has named Henrique Braun to be the company's next CEO after current chief executive James Quincey steps down from the role at the end of March 2026. Braun is currently the EVP and Chief Operating Officer of The Coca‑Cola Company. A panel consisting of Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company CIO Brent Schutte and Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré comment on the changing landscape for consumer brands as Coke becomes the latest company to be welcoming new CEOs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: What leadership changes mean for consumer brands like Coca-Cola
content.description:
Coca-Cola (KO) has named Henrique Braun to be the company's next CEO after current chief executive James Quincey steps down from the role at the end of March 2026. Braun is currently the EVP and Chief Operating Officer of The Coca‑Cola Company.

A panel consisting of Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company CIO Brent Schutte and Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré comment on the changing landscape for consumer brands as Coke becomes the latest company to be welcoming new CEOs.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Coke Taps New CEO to Navigate a World Drinking Less Sugar. What to Watch.
summary: Henrique Braun, a longtime executive at  Coca-Cola Co.  will become the beverage giant’s next CEO in the first quarter of 2026, the company announced on Wednesday.  It’s a familiar playbook for Coca-Cola: promote a seasoned insider, steady the wheel, and signal to investors that the ship will keep moving in its planned direction.  Braun joined Coca-Cola in 1996 and has led operations across Latin America, China, and South Korea before becoming chief operating officer last year.

content.title: Coke Taps New CEO to Navigate a World Drinking Less Sugar. What to Watch.
content.summary: Henrique Braun, a longtime executive at  Coca-Cola Co.  will become the beverage giant’s next CEO in the first quarter of 2026, the company announced on Wednesday.  It’s a familiar playbook for Coca-Cola: promote a seasoned insider, steady the wheel, and signal to investors that the ship will keep moving in its planned direction.  Braun joined Coca-Cola in 1996 and has led operations across Latin America, China, and South Korea before becoming chief operating officer last year.

headline: Stocks to Watch Thursday: Disney, Eli Lilly, Coca-Cola, Rivian
summary: ↗️ Disney (DIS): The company is investing $1 billion in OpenAI and will license its characters for use in ChatGPT and videos. Shares gained 1.7%. The deal was unveiled after Disney accused Google of infringing its copyrights "on a massive scale,” highlighting its carrot-and-stick approach to AI.

headline: With Trump Watching, Coke Makes Clear Its New CEO Is American
summary: Now, the beverage giant wants you to know that its new chief is a real American.  In Wednesday’s press release announcing that Henrique Braun would succeed James Quincey as the company’s top executive, Coca-Cola said Braun “is an American citizen who was born in California and raised in Brazil.”

content.title: With Trump Watching, Coke Makes Clear Its New CEO Is American
content.summary: Now, the beverage giant wants you to know that its new chief is a real American.  In Wednesday’s press release announcing that Henrique Braun would succeed James Quincey as the company’s top executive, Coca-Cola said Braun “is an American citizen who was born in California and raised in Brazil.”
